title: Man shot at Ferguson anniversary protest
text:

Mon, Aug 10, 2015, 16:42 BST - UK Markets closed Man shot at Ferguson anniversary protest By Aideen Kennedy | Sharecast â€“ 25 minutes ago Print 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - A young man was shot in Ferguson, Missouri, on Monday morning amid protests on the anniversary of the killing of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown. The young man is in a "critical, unstable" condition and undergoing surgery, US police confirmed. 
St. Louis County's police chief Jon Belmar said the man opened fire on plain-clothes detectives late before being shot by the officers. 
Belmar also commented that a second shooting involving two groups of people had also taken place on the west side of West Florissant Avenue as a large crowd gathered. 
"They were criminals. They weren't protesters," Belmar said of those involved in the shootings. 
"There is a small group of people out there that are intent on making sure that peace doesn't prevail," he added. "There are a lot of emotions. I get it. But we can't sustain this as we move forward." The shootings followed a day of peaceful demonstrations in Ferguson to commemorate Brown's death last year by a white local police officer. The killing opened the debate on relations between the police and black communities across America.
